net.hudup.core.evaluate

Class DefaultMetric

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.evaluate.AbstractMetric
      • net.hudup.core.evaluate.DefaultMetric
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Alg, Metric
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Accuracy, Accuracy, ArrayMetric, HudupRecallMetric, MetaMetric, TimeMetric, TwoArrayMetric

    public abstract class DefaultMetric
extends AbstractMetric
    Note, the abstract class of Metric interface is {code AbstractMetric}. Three implemented classes of Metric which inherit from AbstractMetric are DefaultMetric, MetaMetric, and MetricWrapper as follows:
    • This DefaultMetric class is default partial implementation of single Metric.
    • MetaMetric class is a complex Metric which contains other metrics.
    • In some situations, if metric requires complicated implementation, it is wrapped by MetricWrapper class.
    The most important aspect of this default metric is that default metric provides the method recalc0(MetricValue). The Metric.recalc(Object...) method will call the #recalc0(MetricValue) method. The #recalc0(MetricValue) method is to accumulate metric value at each iteration.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentValue

        public MetricValue getCurrentValue()
        Description copied from interface: Metric
        Methods Metric.getAccumValue() and Metric.getAccumValue() return accumulative value and current value of metric. After each time metric is re-calculated by Metric.recalc(Object...) method, accumulative value and current value can be changed. For example, a sample metric receives values 3, 1, 2 at the first, second, and third calculations. At the fourth calculation if Metric.recalc(Object...) produces value 2, the Metric.getCurrentValue() will return 2 and the Metric.getAccumValue() will return 3 + 1 + 2 + 2 = 8. Methods Metric.getAccumValue() and Metric.getCurrentValue() can return any thing and so their returned value is represented by MetricValue interface. How to implement MetricValue is dependent on concrete application.
        Returns:
        current MetricValue

      • getAccumValue

        public MetricValue getAccumValue()
        Description copied from interface: Metric
        Methods Metric.getAccumValue() and Metric.getAccumValue() return accumulative value and current value of metric. After each time metric is re-calculated by Metric.recalc(Object...) method, accumulative value and current value can be changed. For example, a sample metric receives values 3, 1, 2 at the first, second, and third calculations. At the fourth calculation if Metric.recalc(Object...) produces value 2, the Metric.getCurrentValue() will return 2 and the Metric.getAccumValue() will return 3 + 1 + 2 + 2 = 8. Methods Metric.getAccumValue() and Metric.getCurrentValue() can return any thing and so their returned value is represented by MetricValue interface. How to implement MetricValue is dependent on concrete application.
        Returns:
        accumulated MetricValue

        Reseting this metric, which makes this metric in original status.

      • recalc0

        protected boolean recalc0(MetricValue metricValue)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        The Metric.recalc(Object...) method will call the recalc0(MetricValue) method. This method is to accumulate metric value at each iteration.
        Parameters:
        metricValue - specified metric value.
        Returns:
        whether calculating successfully.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if any error raises.
